oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Green manuring in organic vegetable production – first results
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Koller, Martin
Vieweger, Anja
Mäder, Paul
Total, René
Bauermeister, Regula
Baur, Robert
Suter, Daniel
Mayer, Jochen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Vegetables
Composting and manuring
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Green manuring is an important tool in organic vegetable growing by fixing nitrogen, recycling nutrients in the rotation, and maintaining soil fertility through adding organic matter. The aim of this project was to optimise the incorporation of different green manure mixtures and to optimise green manuring during winter after vegetable crops with a late harvest in autumn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Koller, Martin; Vieweger, Anja; Mäder, Paul; Total, René; Bauermeister, Regula; Baur, Robert; Suter, Daniel and Mayer, Jochen (2005) Green manuring in organic vegetable production – first results. Ekologiskt Lantbruk, 2005 (45), pp. 17-18.
